title: What is a PLU?
text: A PLU is a Price Look Up
description: A PLU is a Price Look Up

title: Where can permissions for users be changed.
text: Q) - We have a 'View Trains' button on our tills, which is a command linked to 'sessions/ tours'. Clicking it takes the user to a page where they can see all the tours and people booked onto those tours. But most of our users apart from admin cannot get to this screen due to permissions. Where can this be changed. A) - Going into permissions and selecting the desired security groups will fix this. (see Below)
description:
Q) - We have a 'View Trains' button on our tills, which is a command linked to 'sessions/ tours'.  Clicking it takes the user to a page where they can see all the tours and people booked onto those tours. But most of our users apart from admin cannot get to this screen due to permissions. Where can this be changed. 



A) - Going into permissions and selecting the desired security groups will fix this. (see Below)

title: Does completing a future booking appear in the daily transaction analysis ?
text: Q) - Why when I complete a future booking today and select to complete it for the date booked does it appear in the daily transaction analysis for today? A) - When completing a booking ahead of time the system will always process the transaction at the time of completion. The pop option displayed in your screenshot below is relating to the date you want to have displayed on the ticket and when you want footfall to appear.
description:
Q) - Why when I complete a future booking today and select to complete it for the date booked does it appear in the daily transaction analysis for today?



A) - When completing a booking ahead of time the system will always process the transaction at the time of completion. The pop option displayed in your screenshot below is relating to the date you want to have displayed on the ticket and when you want footfall to appear.

title: How do I view the seats of the bookings
text: Q) - How do I view the seats of the bookings A) - Go to view bookings in the seating plan screen to view the seats of bookings.
description:
Q) - How do I view the seats of the bookings

A) - Go to view bookings in the seating plan screen to view the seats of bookings.

title: Does cutting and pasting bookings from one session to another work
text: Q) - does cutting and pasting bookings from one session to another work ? A) - Cutting and pasting Bookings from one session to another will not move the Seats as well as seats on the new session may already be taken and there is no functionality on this, and so would need to be a manual process performed on the back office.
description:
Q) - does cutting and pasting bookings from one session to another work ?


A) - Cutting and pasting Bookings from one session to another will not move the Seats as well as seats on the new session may already be taken and there is no functionality on this, and so would need to be a manual process performed on the back office.

title: Why can’t I allocate seats when on a training till ?
text: Q) - Why can’t I allocate seats when training? A) - You cannot allocate seats on a training till.
description:
Q) - Why can’t I allocate seats when training?


A) - You cannot allocate seats on a training till.

title: Installing / Troubleshooting Gift Aid Manager
text: Please download the GiftAidInstaller.msi from the link below: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/yhsf3sx3880ciyjj84vld/h?rlkey=pou7miqj264bwa3ecu1185ux5&dl=0 Open Add/Remove programs or Control Panel - Programs and Features and remove the existing installation of Gift Aid Manager: (Both ways have the same outcome) Once removed, please run the downloaded GiftAidInstaller.msi This will take you through the install wizard: (Next, Next, Next, Finish) This version will now allow you to submit your gift aid claim. If you do get any errors, please check that your PC has TLS 1.2 enabled: In the Windows search type ‘Internet Options’ Click on the ‘Advanced’ tab and ensure that TLS 1.2 is enabled: Any problems please let us know.
description:
Please download the GiftAidInstaller.msi from the link below:

https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/yhsf3sx3880ciyjj84vld/h?rlkey=pou7miqj264bwa3ecu1185ux5&dl=0

 

Open Add/Remove programs or Control Panel - Programs and Features and remove the existing installation of Gift Aid Manager:

 

 

 

(Both ways have the same outcome)

 

Once removed, please run the downloaded GiftAidInstaller.msi

 

 

This will take you through the install wizard:

 

(Next, Next, Next, Finish)

 

 

 

 

 

This version will now allow you to submit your gift aid claim.

 

If you do get any errors, please check that your PC has TLS 1.2 enabled:

In the Windows search type ‘Internet Options’

 

Click on the ‘Advanced’ tab and ensure that TLS 1.2 is enabled:

 

 

Any problems please let us know.

title: Enabling / Setting up the Marketing Questionnaire
text: The Marketing Questionnaire is not enabled by default. If you require this setting up please contact a member of the support team who will need to add a security setting to the database first. ----------------- Before creating a new questionnaire, I would advise adding the required questions to the system first. Click on Edit, View/Edit Questions: Add questions as required: Add a Questionnaire name and section (the questionnaire can be broken down into multiple sections if required) Add each question that is required. (If you want to include questions set up on a scale, you need to enable the 'Use on a scale' tick box: Add the required questions: Enabling access for the questionnaire. Within Security groups you will now find the option to 'Allow Marketing Questionnaire' Right click to enable: (This needs to be enabled for every group of users that requires access to it) Within System Options click on the User Defined tab, you can then select the questionnaire you have just created to make it active. In Till Configuration set the required questionnaire: On the till, you will need to add a button to bring up the questionnaire: (Command 'Show Questionnaire') Answered questions turn green, unanswered questions are red. If you select declined to answer the box will turn grey and move on. Troubleshooting: If you get a pop up asking for a login pin, the user group does not have access. Needs to be enabled in Security Groups.
description:
The Marketing Questionnaire is not enabled by default. 



If you require this setting up please contact a member of the support team who will need to add a security setting to the database first.


-----------------


Before creating a new questionnaire, I would advise adding the required questions to the system first. 

Click on Edit, View/Edit Questions:



Add questions as required:



Add a Questionnaire name and section (the questionnaire can be broken down into multiple sections if required)



Add each question that is required. (If you want to include questions set up on a scale, you need to enable the 'Use on a scale' tick box:



Add the required questions:



Enabling access for the questionnaire. 


Within Security groups you will now find the option to 'Allow Marketing Questionnaire'



Right click to enable:



(This needs to be enabled for every group of users that requires access to it)


Within System Options click on the User Defined tab, you can then select the questionnaire you have just created to make it active.



In Till Configuration set the required questionnaire:



On the till, you will need to add a button to bring up the questionnaire:

(Command 'Show Questionnaire')




Answered questions turn green, unanswered questions are red. If you select declined to answer the box will turn grey and move on. 


Troubleshooting:


If you get a pop up asking for a login pin, the user group does not have access. Needs to be enabled in Security Groups.

title: Updating Database Server String For Cloud-Hosted Customers
text: As part of our drive to increase security for our cloud-hosted database customers, MStore Back Office users, or IT on behalf of MStore Back Office users, will be asked to update their connection details. This will only be required to be done once per Back Office PC. This will be part of K3 updating every device that uses MStore (POS, Back Office, kiosk, stock taking, MACS Scanning). Before making these changes, you will need to consult either your colleagues or the K3 support team to acquire your encrypted string. The instructions are as follows: Open a File Explorer window. This can be done by pressing the Windows key with the letter E on your keyboard. When the File Explorer window appears, type in C:\ProgramData\Merac within the top address bar (highlighted below), and press Enter on your keyboard. Double-click on the MStore(.ini) file (highlighted above). Insert your encrypted string to the end of the Server=...999 line, making sure the string you are inserting starts with a vertical bar (|), to follow ...999. Please note, the encrypted string in the picture below is for demonstration purposes only. You will need to consult a colleague or K3 support to get your encrypted string. Save the MStore(.ini) file. You can then test your access by logging into the MStore Back Office using the more secure connection. If you receive the below error, please go through this process again to make sure this is correct. If you still cannot resolve this, please speak to K3 support, who will be happy to help.
description:
As part of our drive to increase security for our cloud-hosted database customers, MStore Back Office users, or IT on behalf of MStore Back Office users, will be asked to update their connection details. This will only be required to be done once per Back Office PC.


This will be part of K3 updating every device that uses MStore (POS, Back Office, kiosk, stock taking, MACS Scanning).


Before making these changes, you will need to consult either your colleagues or the K3 support team to acquire your encrypted string.


 The instructions are as follows:


  1. Open a File Explorer window. This can be done by pressing the Windows key with the letter E on your keyboard.
  2. When the File Explorer window appears, type in C:\ProgramData\Merac within the top address bar (highlighted below), and press Enter on your keyboard.
  3. Double-click on the MStore(.ini) file (highlighted above).
  4. Insert your encrypted string to the end of the Server=...999 line, making sure the string you are inserting starts with a vertical bar (|), to follow ...999. Please note, the encrypted string in the picture below is for demonstration purposes only. You will need to consult a colleague or K3 support to get your encrypted string.
  5. Save the MStore(.ini) file.


You can then test your access by logging into the MStore Back Office using the more secure connection.


If you receive the below error, please go through this process again to make sure this is correct. If you still cannot resolve this, please speak to K3 support, who will be happy to help.

title: Installing MStore 3.15+ Back Office For Back Office PC's
text: This is the guide to install the MStore Back Office software onto Back Office PC's. This can be performed by PC users or IT departments on the users behalf, with administrator privileges on the PC in question. Please note, this is not suitable for Windows XP PC's. Request your sites MStore.ini file from K3 support via the portal: https://support.k3btg.com/ or emailing support@k3btg.com. If this is a re-install, where no files were manually changed, or the server details have not changed, then you can skip this step. Download MStore3.15Setup.exe from the below Dropbox link: MStore3.15Setup.exe. a) You do not need to log into Drop Box to Download this file. Click Download, as shown below. b) Then click Or continue with download only. Your download will then begin. Once your download has completed, please run MStore3.15Setup.exe from your Downloads folder. Grant full permissions for the following folders for all users: C:\ProgramData\Merac C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac (or C:\Program Files\Merac if your PC is 32-bit).See Permission Denied Error for more detail Copy the MStore.ini file you received from K3 support to the following location: C:\ProgramData\Merac. Restart your PC to download the latest files for your version from your database. Alternatively, you can open Windows Services, and restart the MeracUpdater service, waiting 30 seconds to get the same result. Open the Merac Back Office (PMBOS.exe), making sure you do not get any error or ‘out of date’ messages when you log into the Back Office. If you do receive an error, please double-check the above steps, try again, and then contact K3 support to investigate.
description:
This is the guide to install the MStore Back Office software onto Back Office PC's. This can be performed by PC users or IT departments on the users behalf, with administrator privileges on the PC in question. Please note, this is not suitable for Windows XP PC's.


  1. Request your sites MStore.ini file from K3 support via the portal: https://support.k3btg.com/ or emailing support@k3btg.com. If this is a re-install, where no files were manually changed, or the server details have not changed, then you can skip this step.
  2. Download MStore3.15Setup.exe from the below Dropbox link: MStore3.15Setup.exe.
    a) You do not need to log into Drop Box to Download this file. Click Download, as shown below.

    b) Then click Or continue with download only. Your download will then begin.
  3. Once your download has completed, please run MStore3.15Setup.exe from your Downloads folder.
  4. Grant full permissions for the following folders for all users:
    • C:\ProgramData\Merac
    • C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac (or C:\Program Files\Merac if your PC is 32-bit).See Permission Denied Error for more detail
  5. Copy the MStore.ini file you received from K3 support to the following location: C:\ProgramData\Merac.
  6.  Restart your PC to download the latest files for your version from your database. Alternatively, you can open Windows Services, and restart the MeracUpdater service, waiting 30 seconds to get the same result. 
  7. Open the Merac Back Office (PMBOS.exe), making sure you do not get any error or ‘out of date’ messages when you log into the Back Office. If you do receive an error, please double-check the above steps, try again, and then contact K3 support to investigate.

title: Use TeamViewer QuickSupport Tool To Allow K3 Support Access to PC's
text: If part of your support request requires one of our team to connect onto your PC/till in order to resolve your issue, they may request to run our TeamViewer QuickSupport tool to allow us access to your PC/till. Via A URL Link You can do this either by clicking on this link on the PC we require access to: https://get.teamviewer.com/n5h2r2h, which will take you to a TeamViewer page, and begin downloading TeamViewerQS.exe. This will then show in your Windows download's folder, which you can access by opening a Windows Explorer window (This can be done by pressing the Windows button + the letter E on your keyboard), then type C:\Users\%username%\Downloads in the address bar at the top of the window. You then need to double-click on the TeamViewerQS(.exe) application. Once the TeamViewer Window appears, you will then need to tell K3 support Your ID. Via Our Website If you cannot easily use the above link, then you can navigate to www.k3btg.com, click on the Support tab. Then scroll down to the bottom of the support page, until you find Tools. You can then click on the TEAM VIEWER (WINDOWS) button. This will begin downloading TeamViewerQS.exe. This file will then show in your Windows download's folder, which you can access by opening a Windows Explorer window (This can be done by pressing the Windows button + the letter E on your keyboard), then type C:\Users\%username%\Downloads in the address bar at the top of the window. You then need to double-click on the TeamViewerQS(.exe) application. Once the TeamViewer Window appears, you will then need to tell K3 support Your ID and Password.
description:
If part of your support request requires one of our team to connect onto your PC/till in order to resolve your issue, they may request to run our TeamViewer QuickSupport tool to allow us access to your PC/till.


Via A URL Link

You can do this either by clicking on this link on the PC we require access to: https://get.teamviewer.com/n5h2r2h, which will take you to a TeamViewer page, and begin downloading TeamViewerQS.exe. This will then show in your Windows  download's folder, which you can access by opening a Windows Explorer window (This can be done by pressing the Windows button + the letter E on your keyboard), then type C:\Users\%username%\Downloads in the address bar at the top of the window. You then need to double-click on the TeamViewerQS(.exe) application.



Once the TeamViewer Window appears, you will then need to tell K3 support Your ID.


Via Our Website

If you cannot easily use the above link, then you can navigate to www.k3btg.com, click on the Support tab.



Then scroll down to the bottom of the support page, until you find Tools. You can then click on the TEAM VIEWER (WINDOWS) button.



This will begin downloading TeamViewerQS.exe. This file will then show in your Windows download's folder, which you can access by opening a Windows Explorer window (This can be done by pressing the Windows button + the letter E on your keyboard), then type C:\Users\%username%\Downloads in the address bar at the top of the window. You then need to double-click on the TeamViewerQS(.exe) application.


Once the TeamViewer Window appears, you will then need to tell K3 support Your ID and Password.

title: Renewing Membership's New Expiry Date Shorter than Membership Type Duration
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Issue Solution Issue Within either the Back Office or the till program; You are renewing memberships, and the Expires date calculated from the Start Date is showing shorter than the duration of the membership set in Membership Types. Solution This can be due to the Scheme Valid Until date set for that Membership Type within the Back Office, in Setup, Membership Types. If you extend this into the future, the correct membership duration will be calculated, until the Scheme Valid Until date is inside the duration of the membership set. This would be a good time to review all your other valid Membership Types, so you don't get the same issues with these. You will need to recreate till data and update any till to be aware of this update.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Issue
  • Solution

Issue

Within either the Back Office or the till program; You are renewing memberships, and the Expires date calculated from the Start Date is showing shorter than the duration of the membership set in Membership Types. 




Solution

This can be due to the Scheme Valid Until date set for that Membership Type within the Back Office, in Setup, Membership Types.


If you extend this into the future, the correct membership duration will be calculated, until the Scheme Valid Until date is inside the duration of the membership set.


This would be a good time to review all your other valid Membership Types, so you don't get the same issues with these. You will need to recreate till data and update any till to be aware of this update.

Right click on this TeamViewer icon if there is one there and close it out. 6. Then try to open the MeracQS from the file explorer again and it should open

4.

title: Disable Task View & Edge Swiping In Windows 10
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Remove Task View button from the Task Bar Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device' Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe' If you want to disable Task View in Windows 10, because this allows users to access anything other than what the device is used for, you can follow the below: Remove Task View button from the Task Bar Right-click on the Task View icon. click on Show Task View button. Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device' Type in Settings into the Windows Start Bar, clicking on the Settings app. Click on the Privacy button. Click on Activity history. Untick Store my activity history on this device, and Clear activity history. Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe' Type in Group Policy into Windows Start Menu. Click on Edit Group Policy. Within Group Policy Editor, Click on Administrative Templates, Windows Components, Edge UI. Double-click on Allow edge swipe. In this window, click the Disabled radial button, and then OK. Any edge swipes will no longer invoke an system UI.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Remove Task View button from the Task Bar
  • Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device'
  • Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe'


If you want to disable Task View in Windows 10, because this allows users to access anything other than what the device is used for, you can follow the below:


Remove Task View button from the Task Bar

  1. Right-click on the Task View icon.
  2. click on Show Task View button.


Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device'

  1. Type in Settings into the Windows Start Bar, clicking on the Settings app.
  2. Click on the Privacy button.
  3. Click on Activity history.
  4. Untick Store my activity history on this device, and Clear activity history.


Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe'

  1. Type in Group Policy into Windows Start Menu.
  2. Click on Edit Group Policy.
  3. Within Group Policy Editor, Click on Administrative Templates, Windows Components, Edge UI.
  4. Double-click on Allow edge swipe.
  5. In this window, click the Disabled radial button, and then OK.


Any edge swipes will no longer invoke an system UI.

title: Creating an age verification question
text: It is possible to set up challenge questions on PLU's to prompt till operators to check a customers age. To do so you can follow the below steps: 1. Create the challenge question Open back office and find 'Lookup Items' Scroll down the list to find 'Challenge 18' This will then show any existing age restrictions, I believe the 18 question is in the system as default: To add any new challenge questions click on the new icon (Paper looking icon) Add your question as required. It will need a code and a description. 2. Add the challenge question to the PLU Find the PLU you wish to add the age restriction to via Price Lookup Index Tick 'Age Restriction' and set Over to the minimum age required. From the drop down list you can then select which challenge question you require: Ensure you save the changes. 3. Recreate till data to push out changes to the till 4. When the PLU is scanned at the till: If the till operator clicks No the item will automatically be removed from the till basket.
description:
It is possible to set up challenge questions on PLU's to prompt till operators to check a customers age. 


To do so you can follow the below steps:


1. Create the challenge question


Open back office and find 'Lookup Items'



Scroll down the list to find 'Challenge 18'



This will then show any existing age restrictions, I believe the 18 question is in the system as default:



To add any new challenge questions click on the new icon (Paper looking icon)



Add your question as required. It will need a code and a description. 



2. Add the challenge question to the PLU


Find the PLU you wish to add the age restriction to via Price Lookup Index


Tick 'Age Restriction' and set Over to the minimum age required.

From the drop down list you can then select which challenge question you require:



Ensure you save the changes. 


3. Recreate till data to push out changes to the till


4. When the PLU is scanned at the till:



If the till operator clicks No the item will automatically be removed from the till basket.

title: Creating a stock item from a non-stocked item
text: If you have previously created a non-stocked item, (or an admission ticket by default) it's possible to change this within back office. Within Price Lookup Index find the item in question: If you change the Category to 'Stocked Item' you will notice View/Add Stock will show as available: Ensure you click Save to apply the change. Click 'View/Add Stock' To create a stock record for the previously non-stocked item, click Ok.
description:
If you have previously created a non-stocked item, (or an admission ticket by default) it's possible to change this within back office. 


Within Price Lookup Index find the item in question:



If you change the Category to 'Stocked Item' you will notice View/Add Stock will show as available:



Ensure you click Save to apply the change. 


Click 'View/Add Stock'




To create a stock record for the previously non-stocked item, click Ok.

title: Applying / Removing Gift Aid to Memberships
text: Gift Aid can be turned on / off via the Membership PLU Simply browse to Membership Types Select the membership required: Select 'Membership Price' (click on the triangle icon) Enable / Disable the Gift Aid tick box. Re-create till data to apply the change.
description:
Gift Aid can be turned on / off via the Membership PLU


Simply browse to Membership Types



Select the membership required:



Select 'Membership Price' (click on the triangle icon)


Enable / Disable the Gift Aid tick box. 



Re-create till data to apply the change.

title: Uninstalling MStore 3.14 Back Office
text: This is the guide to uninstall the MStore Back Office software for Back Office PC's running 3.14. This can be performed by PC users or IT departments on the users behalf, with administrator privileges on the PC in question. Please follow the below instructions: Download MStore3.14Setup.exe from this Dropbox link: MStore3.14Setup.exe. Run MStore3.14Setup.exe from your Downloads folder. Follow the instructions on the window that appears to the end, choosing to Uninstall the program. Once you click Finish. The software has been successfully uninstalled. If this installation is to install a newer version of MStore, then you may want to visit this Knowledge Base article to see how to perform this: Installing MStore 3.15 Back Office For Back Office PC's.
description:
This is the guide to uninstall the MStore Back Office software for Back Office PC's running 3.14. This can be performed by PC users or IT departments on the users behalf, with administrator privileges on the PC in question. Please follow the below instructions:


  1. Download MStore3.14Setup.exe from this Dropbox link: MStore3.14Setup.exe.

  2. Run MStore3.14Setup.exe from your Downloads folder.

  3. Follow the instructions on the window that appears to the end, choosing to Uninstall the program.

  4. Once you click Finish. The software has been successfully uninstalled.


If this installation is to install a newer version of MStore, then you may want to visit this Knowledge Base article to see how to perform this: Installing MStore 3.15 Back Office For Back Office PC's.

title: How to Clear the Print Queue in Windows
text: If your documents are stuck in the print queue and nothing is printing, don’t worry — clearing the print queue usually fixes the issue. Follow the steps below to cancel all pending print jobs and start fresh. Step-by-Step: Clear the Print Queue Option 1: Using the Printer Menu Open the Start Menu and search for Printers & Scanners. Click on your printer from the list. Select Open print queue (you might need to right click) In the new window, click Printer in the top menu, then select Cancel All Documents. Confirm the action if prompted. If this doesn’t work or the queue is stuck, try the manual method below. Option 2: Manually Restart the Print Spooler Open the Start Menu, search for Services, and open it. Scroll down and find Print Spooler in the list. Right-click it and choose Stop. Open File Explorer and go to: C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS (You may need admin permissions.) Delete all files in this folder — these are the stuck print jobs. Go back to the Services window, right-click Print Spooler again, and choose Start. That's it.
description:
If your documents are stuck in the print queue and nothing is printing, don’t worry — clearing the print queue usually fixes the issue. Follow the steps below to cancel all pending print jobs and start fresh.


Step-by-Step: Clear the Print Queue

Option 1: Using the Printer Menu

  1. Open the Start Menu and search for Printers & Scanners.

  2. Click on your printer from the list.

  3. Select Open print queue (you might need to right click)

  4. In the new window, click Printer in the top menu, then select Cancel All Documents.

  5. Confirm the action if prompted.

If this doesn’t work or the queue is stuck, try the manual method below.


Option 2: Manually Restart the Print Spooler

  1. Open the Start Menu, search for Services, and open it.

  2. Scroll down and find Print Spooler in the list.

  3. Right-click it and choose Stop.

  4. Open File Explorer and go to:
    C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS
    (You may need admin permissions.)

  5. Delete all files in this folder — these are the stuck print jobs.

  6. Go back to the Services window, right-click Print Spooler again, and choose Start.


That's it.

title: Bixolon printer re calibration
text: When trying to print tickets to the Bixolon printer. it feeds multiple tickets through causing ticket wastage. It may just be that the printer needs re calibrating to the ticket stock. There’s separate instructions for calibrating labels with gap sensors and labels with black timing marks. Make sure you are using the correct one! Below are the instructions for calibrating a Bixolon SLP-DX420: Gap Sensor Calibration Press and hold the Pause button for 2 Seconds Press the Feed button when LED 1 is orange and LED 2 blinks green 4 times Black Timing Mark Press and hold the Pause button for 2 Seconds Press the Feed button when LED 1 is orange and LED 2 blinks orange 4 times To see a video of this go to the following link. https://www.smithcorona.com/blog/how-to-calibrate-a-bixolon-slp-dx420/?srsltid=AfmBOopUfgF0Ah2DrU3x5gZzdSJglKpYh9QUOaOKbMRkATuFJidRuAOX
description:
When trying to print tickets to the Bixolon printer.

it feeds multiple tickets through causing ticket wastage.


It may just be that the printer needs re calibrating to the ticket stock.


There’s separate instructions for calibrating labels with gap sensors and labels with black timing marks. Make sure you are using the correct one!

Below are the instructions for calibrating a Bixolon SLP-DX420:

Gap Sensor Calibration

  1. Press and hold the Pause button for 2 Seconds
  2. Press the Feed button when LED 1 is orange and LED 2 blinks green 4 times

Black Timing Mark

  1. Press and hold the Pause button for 2 Seconds
  2. Press the Feed button when LED 1 is orange and LED 2 blinks orange 4 times


To see a video of this go to the following link.
